body_html:
Your ipython and Python have different values for sys.path

Basically you can have multiple Python distributions with their own sets of
libraries, so your Python and ipython probably come from different
distributions

On Aug 2, 2016 7:32 PM, "Deepak" notifications@github.com wrote:

I reinstalled tensorflow, it worked, though a strange ting happened now.
Tensorflow runs fine in the ipython shell, but if I execute the python
program from the terminal I get the following error :

` File "", line 1, in
File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/init.py", line
23, in
from tensorflow.python import *
File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/init.py",
line 58, in
raise ImportError(msg)
ImportError: Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/init.py",
line 52, in
from tensorflow.core.framework.graph_pb2 import *
File
"/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/core/framework/graph_pb2.py",
line 6, in
from google.protobuf import descriptor as _descriptor
ImportError: No module named google.protobuf

Error importing tensorflow. Unless you are using bazel,
you should not try to import tensorflow from its source directory;
please exit the tensorflow source tree, and relaunch your python
interpreter
from there.
`

I saw a fix at #1415
http://url. But why does this only occur when I execute the python
program and not in the ipython shell ?

Thanks!

—
You are receiving this because you commented.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
#3616 (comment),
or mute the thread
https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AABaHCixEPbKPbByga_55cy4vkSge0Giks5qb_2ygaJpZM4JbOvB
.

Your ipython and Python have different values for sys.path
Basically you can have multiple Python distributions with their own sets of
libraries, so your Python and ipython probably come from different
distributions
On Aug 2, 2016 7:32 PM, "Deepak" notifications@github.com wrote:

Tensorflow runs fine in the ipython shell, but if I execute the python

23, in

from there.

body:
Your ipython and Python have different values for sys.path

Basically you can have multiple Python distributions with their own sets of
libraries, so your Python and ipython probably come from different
distributions

On Aug 2, 2016 7:32 PM, "Deepak" notifications@github.com wrote:

> I reinstalled tensorflow, it worked, though a strange ting happened now.
> Tensorflow runs fine in the ipython shell, but if I execute the python
> program from the terminal I get the following error :
> 
> ` File "", line 1, in
> File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/_init_.py", line
> 23, in
> from tensorflow.python import *
> File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_init_.py",
> line 58, in
> raise ImportError(msg)
> ImportError: Traceback (most recent call last):
> File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_init_.py",
> line 52, in
> from tensorflow.core.framework.graph_pb2 import *
> File
> "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/core/framework/graph_pb2.py",
> line 6, in
> from google.protobuf import descriptor as _descriptor
> ImportError: No module named google.protobuf
> 
> Error importing tensorflow. Unless you are using bazel,
> you should not try to import tensorflow from its source directory;
> please exit the tensorflow source tree, and relaunch your python
> interpreter
> from there.
> `
> 
> I saw a fix at https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/1415
> http://url. But why does this only occur when I execute the python
> program and not in the ipython shell ?
> 
> Thanks!
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
